w:r.w:t: A hair dryer contains three heating elements.
The figure below shows the circuit diagram for the heating elements in the hair dryer.
In the figure the heating elements are represented by resistor symbols.
The three resistors in above diagram are connected in _______________ with the power supply.
Which switch must always be closed for the hair dryer to work?
Which switches must be closed for the hair dryer to work at maximum power output?
Use the Physics Equations Sheet to answer parts (d) and (e).
Write down the equation which links energy transferred (
The heating elements have a maximum power output of 1200 W.
The energy transferred to the heating elements to reach normal operating temperature is 3600 J.
Calculate the time taken for the heating elements to reach normal operating temperature at maximum power output.
The hair dryer has LEDs to indicate the power setting.
What is the circuit symbol for an LED?
A student investigated how the current in a circuit varied with the number of lamps connected in parallel in the circuit.
shows the circuit with three identical lamps connected in parallel.
Each answer can be used once, more than once or not at all.
As the number of lamps increased, the current __________________.
As the number of lamps increased, the total resistance of the circuit
As the number of lamps increased, the potential difference across the battery

A student investigated how the total resistance of identical resistors connected in series varied with the number of resistors.
The student used an ohmmeter to measure the total resistance of the resistors.
The diagram below shows the student’s circuit with 3 resistors.
The student repeated each reading of resistance three times.
The table below shows the student’s results for 3 resistors in series.
Calculate the mean resistance of 1 resistor.
What was the resolution of the ohmmeter the student used?
How do the results show that the student’s measurements were precise?
The measurements are grouped closely together.
The graph below shows the results.
How do the results show that the total resistance is directly proportional to the number of resistors?
The results give a line with a positive gradient.
The results give a straight line that would go through the origin.
The results show a linear relationship.

energy transferred = charge flow × potential difference
